message.content:
Below is a worked‐through example of how one can interpret and match the target build.  I have broken it into three parts as requested:

------------------------------------------------------------
1)  DESCRIPTION OF THE MAIN TARGET IMAGE
------------------------------------------------------------
•  Overall Block Count and Layering
   –  There are 16 total blocks in the structure.  
   –  The build can be viewed in three main “sections” (left, center bridging, and right), all tied together by a continuous yellow layer.  

•  Left Section
   –  Bottom Layer:  Two red arches side by side (arches facing front).  
   –  Middle Layer:  Two yellow rectangular blocks spanning across the two arches.  
   –  Top Layer:     Three red blocks:
                     (a)  Red rectangular on the left  
                     (b)  Red arch in the middle (arch again facing front)  
                     (c)  Red rectangular on the right  

•  Center Bridging
   –  Bottom Layer:  One red arch (front‐facing) bridging toward the right.  
   –  Top Layer:     One yellow rectangular block directly above that center arch.  

•  Right Section
   –  Bottom Layer:  One red arch (front‐facing).  
   –  Second Layer:  One yellow rectangular block on top of that arch.  
   –  Third Layer:   Two green cubes side by side.  
   –  Fourth Layer:  Two blue blocks (one in front, one in back) stacked on the green cubes.  
   –  Topmost Block:  One orange wedge sitting above the blue blocks like a “roof.”  

------------------------------------------------------------
2)  SELECTING REQUIRED BLOCKS & INDICES
------------------------------------------------------------
Below are the block indices (from the Dictionary image) that match the shape, color, **and orientation** exactly (no rotation allowed):

•  Red Arches (front‐facing) → Block‑index 1  
   Needed 5 times total  
•  Red Rectangular Bricks → Block‑index 14  
   Needed 2 times  
•  Yellow Rectangular Blocks (oriented lengthwise left–right) → Block‑index 9  
   Needed 4 times  
•  Green Cubes → Block‑index 5  
   Needed 2 times  
•  Blue Rectangular Blocks (two slightly different orientations) → Block‑index 7 and Block‑index 8  
   One of each  
•  Orange Wedge (angled left–right) → Block‑index 13  
   Needed 1 time  

------------------------------------------------------------
3)  STEP‑BY‑STEP ASSEMBLY INSTRUCTIONS
------------------------------------------------------------
Below is one logical assembly order from the ground up, left to right:

{
  Step1:  Move block with index 1        // Left bottom arch (left)
  Step2:  Move block with index 1        // Left bottom arch (right)
  Step3:  Move block with index 9        // Left middle layer (yellow, left piece)
  Step4:  Move block with index 9        // Left middle layer (yellow, right piece)
  Step5:  Move block with index 14       // Left top layer (red rectangular, left)
  Step6:  Move block with index 1        // Left top layer (red arch)
  Step7:  Move block with index 14       // Left top layer (red rectangular, right)
  Step8:  Move block with index 1        // Center bridging arch (red)
  Step9:  Move block with index 9        // Center bridging yellow block
  Step10: Move block with index 1        // Right bottom arch (red)
  Step11: Move block with index 9        // Right yellow block (on arch)
  Step12: Move block with index 5        // Right section green cube (front)
  Step13: Move block with index 5        // Right section green cube (back)
  Step14: Move block with index 7        // Blue block (front)
  Step15: Move block with index 8        // Blue block (back)
  Step16: Move block with index 13       // Orange wedge on top
}

Following these steps with the exact block indices/orientations will recreate the target structure as shown in the main image.
